Madhupiṇḍika’s Birth Story
“Having seen in the forest grove,🔽in a place with little noise and secluded,
the Siddhattha, the best of sages,🔽the receiver of offerings,
the great nāga who had attained Nibbāna,
like a mountain of solid rock,
shining like a medicine plant,

analyzed: deva saṅgha namaḥ sita  vitti mama āhu tāvade
translated: honoured by the assembly of gods.🔽Joy arose in me then,
knowledge arose in me then;
Having arisen from concentration,
having given honey to the Teacher.
Having worshipped the Teacher’s feet,🔽I departed facing east;
In the thirty-fourth (cycle of) time,
I was the king Sudassana.
Honey flowed from my rice and curry,
and in my food at that time;
A rain of honey fell,
this was the fruit of my past deeds.
For ninety-four (cycles of) time,
the honey I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving honey.
For thirty-four (cycles of) time from now,
you will be four Sudassanas;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four discriminations,
